name: kazad
text: Ray is a terrible email friend to have.

name: cleave
text: Notice though that Beef has replied to every single email.  What a friend.

name: catachresis
text:
One of those panels where I never looked twice until the comments made me
Thank you, kind sir/madam

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, kylank, RedGuy, mystkmanat, Lokiamis, Garyos)

name: farqussus
text: nt

name: cleave
text:
I've changed my pic to more aptly reflect my hard-drinkin' Harley-ridin' chain-wieldin' male-and-chauvinistic persona.

Oh and you're welcome =)

name: arkaic
text: amen nice observation

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yeah, but I always figured the replies were like "man why you keep sending me this stuff" etc.  It's like those times when Ray is telling Beef about this kind of trivia in person, and Beef just sits there reading a magazine and ignoring Ray almost completely.

name: littlecat
text: no, we only see the ones that Beef replied to. What I noticed is that Beef doesn't write to him on his own accord, only in replies!

name: goriasxy
text: WAY. SAD.

name: eviltkat
text: Ray's sent Roast Beef that picture of that girl kissing the phallic golf trophy, like, fifty times.

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text: 'dancing baby turns 10 - hella poignant' is what made this one for me

name: clembot
text: A comment left by clembot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Crowpaw, kylank, Gumfish)

name: connormc
text: I've read this comic a hundred times and it was only in noticing your comment that I went "wait a 9-year-old dancing child is by no means a baby" so, y'know, thanks for that.

name: deusoma
text: You know, I'm not Chris Onstad, so I don't know for sure, but I'm pretty sure that Ray was talking about the Dancing Baby , not just a dancing baby.

name: closefriend
text: "Rediculous" is the #1 dead indicator that the writer is unaware of exactly what s/he is talking about.

name: spinynorman
text:
Don't forget "definatly."

Goddamn it.

name: tekende
text: I will definatly not forget these rediculous things, gents.

name: riazm
text: The man has a .exe (dot e-ex-e) to prove his identity.

name: afterward
text: This messes with my mind. How, precisely, does the executable file prove a guy's identity? It is unknown.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: the point is, it never would in the real world, it would in fact be a virus and the guy getting the email would not know what an .exe is, well he wouldn't if he fell for it.

name: wehavemagnums
text: I love the fact that Ray finds the dancing baby turning 10 to be "hella poignant".

name: andrew_
text: All of the people on the floor are dancing it up to the new song Gravity Train

name: lordsorasen
text:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wrQjMslFutc

It would be this

name: swarm_of_bears
text: I don't know why, but for some reason I hear Ray's voice  in this strip as Samuel L. Jackson's. Give it a try, you'll love the results.

name: deptford
text: Best advice I've heard in a long time.

name: senseihollywood
text: turns out that guy is a hero AND a fatso...go figure

name: hassanoleary
text:
That one caught my eye, too. If the heroism is in question, it suggests someone was perhaps unintentionally heroic and that his/her body mass played a significant factor.

"Local behemoth obstructs bank entrance, foils robbery in progress."

name: junko
text: I really expected this to be a one-off . . then a two-off . . then it just kept going! I think a lot of the "arcs" are just jokes the author still thinks are funny the next day.

name: mugi
text: Chubby for a brilliant definition of "arc."

name: cpnglxynchos
text: seconded.

name: ssddr
text: I think Onstad must have discovered http://www.419eater.com/ i few days before this.

name: hip-hobbit
text: take a hike, advice!

name: kneejerk
text: In panel four, Ray is APPALLED.

name: mountaindewtab
text: scams are not funny but this is still a 5

name: cousinted
text: Scams are never funny, unless a clown is being scammed.

name: jugglegod
text:
Just thought I'd post a link to my Leon Sumbitches experience recently, hope you enjoy it!

http://denver.craigslist.org/mis/436683191.html

name: i_love_kate
text: I dislike this arc. I'm just going to say it now, and save repeating it on the next dozen or so strips. Its too conventional for Achewood. The irony of such an e-mail actually being honest and the main character suffering for their presumption is what I'd expect to be reading in twenty or so far worse webcomics. Here, it just leaves me wanting for more Mexican Realism.

name: goocifer
text: I think the arc is still funny, but yeah, I saw a pretty similar storyline on Hangin with Mr. Cooper...

name: fosters
text:
I love it not so much for the situation itself, which as you said has been done before, but for the details.

The guy's name is Leon Sumbitches/Brian Wheat and Brian Wheat is the FAKE one. He wrote a song called Gravity Train. He called Ray a toilet seat smoking a cigar. Ray uses the phrase "straight-up splickety." Nmbota had an accident of the government. "Hilarious!"

There is so much comedy gold in here the premise could be a thousand times more generic and it'd still be straight 5s from beginning to end.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Oh, God, no. I can't fault the comedy. The comedy is omnipresent. Any man who says that this arc isn't funny is lying through his yellowing teeth.

But you know what else is funny? Jackass.

name: tekende
text:
No.

No, it isn't.

name: semiquaver
text:
Warning: if you feel the need to complain on the Internet that a comic you like is really damn funny but just not original, you may have no real problems of your own.

Sorry, but it had to be said.

name: i_love_kate
text: Very true. I have no real problems, bastard that I am.

name: semiquaver
text: I suggest therapy, or politics.

name: comeister
text: Boo to this comment.  Spoiler!

name: mattylite
text: Dude, don't be rediculous.  Read them all first, on the main pages, then read the comments.  At this point in the arhives I can't imagine there is a SINGLE STRIP that hasn't been referenced.

name: heccibiggs
text: I got an e-mail like this the other day. I couldn't believe they still existed.

name: moolah
text: Do you guys think Ray's email alert is the Sublime cover or the original version by The Toyes?

name: mangtastic
text: It should be both, played at the same time.  I only lissen to d-d-d-double music!

name: phthoggos
text: 5 because I just stared at panel 3 and laughed and laughed

name: biznart
text: Leon Sumbitches is basically the best name in the world.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Pat: Cornelius's new pub absolutely disgusts me.
Teodor: Foto-Kwiz No. 2
Mr. Bear: The Dude and Catastrophe: A modest success!

Today's Blogs

Teodor: Foto-Kwiz #3

"The Germans have their shiny shoes, and the Chinese have electrical engineering students raining off of high rooftops, but give me the French any day."

name: arelladawn
text: What is up with Ray's mouth in panel 4?  It's like he is having a bulldog moment.

name: rowboat
text: His paw is covering the lower half of it. You are the one having a "bulldog moment."

name: arelladawn
text: Thanks, I see it now.

name: fatcat
text: I swear to god I read that bit in the last panel as "My uncle Mengis Adoso, as you have a beard..." like three times before I got it right. God I am so sleep-deprived.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a chubby for you for two reasons..first 'cos sleep deprivation is a regular thing for me and secondly 'cos that which you said was funny.

name: genequagmire
text: I kill two dwarves in the morning...
